author: albert.feghaly
title: OpenScienceNFT Marketplace
description: Scientific knowledge is often locked behind paywalls, in spite of it being mostly funded by the public. Science should be more accessible.

f6_assessments.q0:
A very well articulated and presented proposal that fits in perfectly with the challenge settings.  The Problem statement is easy to understand and being a Software Engineer myself I have first hand seen situations where a lot of good content/scientific work is unavailable to the general public even though the funding comes from public domains. 

This proposal, if implemented successfully, is trying to address such a problem and provides an indepth look on the multi variance of this problem.  The proposal has already considered the legal framework which will be important to realize the success of this proposal. Therefore, in my opinion this proposal will have a good potential to not only improve cardano network strength but also aligns with the vision and goal of cardano, that is to have an equal opportunities world going forward.
f6_assessments.q1:
The  team from this proposal has already gotten a successful funding in the previous round, and this proposal builds on top of the work that was promised/targeted in Fund 6 proposal. 

The experience of the team is publicly available, and the latest update from the team is routinely updated on the link provided in the proposal. 

The plan is very ambitious, and a detailed layout has been provided both from bird eye perspective (to always have an eye on big picture) and at the same time detailed description on osNFT monetization strategies. Clearly team has thought through the roadmap and milestones, and an impact of these roadmap, with execution milestones in 3-6-12 months has been given. 

It makes sense that while team has allowed community to have an upfront details on long term roadmap, but also that team has restricted themselves to this funding round in terms of budget asked for. The budget breakup is justified to me, and i am sure team will have lot of success and a positive feedback loop with community, leading to the success of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
I strongly agree that information provided here is sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal. Team is public and a link to their website where they are posting weekly progress updates is a good way for community to keep an eye on routine development.

Additionally, the website gives in the different phases details, which each phase expecting a set of features along with the estimated timelines to it. This in combination with weekly updates gives a good positive feedback loop to the community, so that any changes to the projected roadmap is quickly propagated to the community.

Overall, very detailed and good write up for this proposal and hence full points from my side.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposers want to create an academic market place for accessible research, that could be staked, sold or borrowed. There's a problem mentioned in the proposal that academic research is not so easily available although it's mostly public. I didn't know that, but after doing a bit of reserach I see the problem is real and it fits the challenge settings. The proposal adds an exhaustive explanation of the value it will add to do the cardano system, by bringing in more academics to the cardano community. The goals of the proposal are exactly what every community strives for: more educated people, people of action on board. After reading the proposal I have no doubt in my mind the authors will have no problems scaling their solution to measure up with the scaling challenges they will be faced with. I have read quite a few proposals now north of 40 and I don't see any key items missing from this one. The proposal would include the academic sphere and will create a marketplace that would help some underprivileged academics as well, which is really noble.  This is a great proposal, I'll be voting and rooting for them!
f6_assessments.q1: The authors have grown their team since the last funding round which was a nice surprise for me. This means two things: 1. They have been successfulyly voted in and worked on a proposal already. 2. Their idea is good enough to attract other academics and their drive. The credentials are verifiable as the authors have linked the whole teams linkedin accounts. The team is forming up to be a formitable one, as it's formed from members arround the world. The budget is described and broken down in detail. There are reasonable and achievable goals. I'm not an expert by any means in the academic environment, but as far as coding and developing goes, as a dev their roadmap and timetable seem sensible and entirely doable. The plan for implementation seems solit and sequential. All the resources necessary to implement the proposal are listed, and quite a few scenarios like decentralization, future governance as well as bringing more people on board are well thought out and detailed. The technical aspects of the proposal are mentioned as well. The languages and technologies that are going to be used along with the reason why. The proposers have considered chaallenges and risk relevant to the implementation and set goal. I especially liked the fact they've thought of different ways to make use of their osNFT token. These academics have done their research on what's alreday available, and will build on top of other community members building bricks which is the wright way to do open source development. Overall this is a feasible solution and I can't wait for it to be a reality.
f6_assessments.q2: Unlike many other proposals, I'm not worried about tracability. In their linked site, the authros have created a section called weekly updates where, they interract with all people interested in their project and give progress updates. Further down the line, they plan on having a section with blog post articles on what's being done and how is the progress commuing along. That's an excelent channel to keep the community involved and intrigued. There are relevant metrics and KPIs mentioned that IMHO are in line with the projects success. There's a birds eye view of the path as well as milestones all in a doable time frame. A clear understandable description of the targeted problem and a detailed, well thought out academic description for the solution.   I will you all the best. Keep doing what you're doing!

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims for a continuing of the funding after the project received funding in the previous round. The team has been spending time and funds to research and set up a framework, deal with copyright issues and other relevant topics around creating a science marketplace in combination with an NFT model. One of the objectives is to get rid of paywalls so that more people have access to scientific papers - another objective is to reward scientists and give the opportunity for them to receive funding for future work.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is multi-disciplinary and does include academics as well as developers - so the necessary skillset of the team matches the objectives and enhances the likelyhood of this proposal being implemented successfully. The prior work and the references provided are very positive and on task and it is nice to see how excited the team is about their project, I like it. I think the proposing team has done good work at looking at the necessary issues that come with creating such a marketplace, which is good. I´m an academic researcher with more than 7 years of experience both as a peer reviewer as well as a published academic in peer reviewed academic journals. While I think that the process of reviewing the quality of a paper or a study could be improved, I do not believe that the peer review process is meaningless, I find it important that internal and external validity of a research design is monitored to ensure that . The way that this group of people are brainstorming and creating a framework to include researchers with less access to funding is great and could contribute widely to a fairer system of how science and scientists can use their research.
f6_assessments.q2: The team is a prior funded team that is now seeking additional funding to continue their work. They are providing several very thorough ways of auditing their progress, the team is very transparent, the roadmap and the goals are realistic and the budget makes sense. The skillset of the team matches the task, the work they have been doing since they got funded is very goal oriented and the project is taking shape while the team seems to be very excited about this project. Overall great.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal spells out a useful tool for the scientific community and a powerful draw for ADA adoption through NFTs.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has made good headway and clearly considered many of the potential stumbling blocks for their ambitious set of goals. This is an already funded proposal that has done good work. The budget and roadmap are transparent and feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The team's credentials, a plethora of readily available resources such as github, and the well-defined roadmap all point to a transparent and auditable product.

f6_assessments.q0: In academic world, we didn't realize how much scientists' hard-work could be overlooked and under appreciated inside this multi-billion dollar industry (scientific publishing). This proposal deliver a solution to give that ownership back to them, the scientist, with building an OpenScienceNFT Marketplace. This project will help the academic world become decentralized and independent from the middleman (that is the publishing firm), and get royalties paid directly to the scientists. This will help not only the adoption of Cardano, but the independent scientific academy to self sustain itself without the need of publishing industries.
f6_assessments.q1: Previously, OpenScienceNFT project have been successfully funded on Fund 6, and it progressing well and on track. The team is proven to be capable and experienced, looking at the progress have been accomplished, and I have no doubt that it will continue with this Fund 7. The team not only consists of developer and technical people, but also advisors in respective field to further support the project development. The roadmap provided is clear and explained in detail, with the 3-step roadmap of 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months. The budget is broken down into details, to work hours and weeks, and salary is well explained too. This proposal also manage to highlight the challenge and risks by looking at legal aspect, how the governance work, etc. Overall, this is a well prepared proposal and project, proven to deliver after successfully funded on Fund 6, and have a great track record of experienced team.
f6_assessments.q2: Previously, OpenScienceNFT project have been successfully funded on Fund 6, and it progressing well and on track. The team is proven to be capable and experienced, looking at the progress have been accomplished, and I have no doubt that it will continue with this Fund 7. The team not only consists of developer and technical people, but also advisors in respective field to further support the project development. The roadmap provided is clear and explained in detail, with the 3-step roadmap of 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months. The budget is broken down into details, to work hours and weeks, and salary is well explained too. This proposal also manage to highlight the challenge and risks by looking at legal aspect, how the governance work, etc. Overall, this is a well prepared proposal and project, proven to deliver after successfully funded on Fund 6, and have a great track record of experienced team.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal speaks directly to the main objectives of the challenge, by implementing NFT for researchers can publish, retain ownership of their work and distribute it to the general population in a marketable fashion. The science innovation often not available for public, despite it being mostly funded by the public. This project will be a solution to make science and knowledge more accessible for the non-scientific community. The use of NFT as main source of ownership is already common and widely accepted in the world. Should this project able to convince science community to join, it could bring more credible credential to Blockchain especially Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: Team consist of multiple individuals with significant credential who hold PHD and Post Doc. Given the combined experience presented by its team member, it is highly likely that the project can be a huge success. Team provides clear roadmap and requests a reasonable budget with detailed breakdown. The whitepaper provided by the team has depth technical explanation. Problem statement and solution delivered match and both address the challenge effectively. Success measure of this project is very reasonable, and team has explained clearly their step-by-step execution plan. This proposal is one of the best in Fund 7 and should be voted by the community.
f6_assessments.q2: The success criteria provided the proposal is reasonable and achievable that make the project feasible and realistic. Team does not mention where they will publish the progress of project execution making their web as the only source of monitor or audit the project. So, the team can improve the execution of this project by posting the detailed budget spending on cardano forum so it can be audited by the community member. This project is the one holding most potential in Fund 7 and should be voted by the community.

f6_assessments.q0:
Publishing scientific research is necessary for the development of human beings, it will help people to learn - understand - develop this world better and faster. And one of the big values that bring to the digital world is preventing info manipulation or fake info that is happening every day. 
This project will have a huge impact on the Cardano ecosystem, not by just its idea that can drive and keep sustainable users, but also as the team points out in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
A part of this project was funded in the fund6 and the team finished it well, now they made this proposal for the next step of their roadmap. There, I absolutely support them in this proposal. 
They have a good vision and detailed info that can help us well know about what the team will do to make the idea come true. For this fund, they have a reasonably required budget that fits with the plan in the scope of 6 weeks.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team provides various ways to track and audit their project. Their roadmap and key results also are clear and detailed, which makes the auditing process easier. 
Sure that they have a good acknowledgment about the problem context that is detailed in the referral proposal in fund 6, and that helps to better understand their solution explanation.

solution: With osNFTs, researchers can publish, retain ownership of their work and distribute it to the general population in a marketable fashion.
experience:
Bioinformatics, Python, JS, Big Data, ML, AI, Blockchain.
Team = 5 + 3 Advisors -> https://intellart.ca/#/team
PhD-level, Post-doc-level.
